nodes.description: Step 0 — Setup: Create run folder (unique descriptive name, e.g. RUN_24_IDEATION_WAVE_23_MENTAL_MODELS). Add run brief: run type (ideation/scoring/landscape-only/deep-dive), bar (WTF/standard), focus (e.g. no F&B, why future), date. Read core references: 18 (bar), 17 (current ideas), 19 (memory). Confirm bar and pay-now apply. Output: run folder path, run brief (00_RUN_BRIEF.md).

Step 1 — Resource collection (MANDATORY): Gather raw inputs—quantitative, qualitative, primary, secondary, regulatory, competitive/landscape. Qualify each: recency (2025–2026), authority, relevance, bias, actionability, reproducibility. Label: qualified / use with care / reject. Note invisible dot or gap per source. Output: 01_RESOURCE_PACK.md—source label, type, date, key fact(s), qualification, invisible dot/gap. NO idea list yet. Reference: §1a.

Step 2 — Landscape/competition analysis (MANDATORY): Define scope (space/vertical). Run four checks: (1) Incumbents ~$50M ARR—need signal not their main focus; (2) Well-funded $15M–50M same/similar—must not exist or need clear wedge; (3) Bootstrap/<$15M—good sign, note them; (4) No competition—explain why. Output: 02_LANDSCAPE_ANALYSIS.md. Players research = part of idea research.

Step 3 — Generate: Ideas FROM resource pack + landscape. Link each idea to source(s) and landscape (e.g. no well-funded player in wedge). Apply: why now = AI only; trends linked; check 17 (no repeats); recurring daily/weekly; pivot (agent acts, trust-friendly ICP, 1-click). Output: 03_RAW_IDEAS.md—one-liner, trend, link to sources, why now (AI), landing-page draft.

Step 4 — Score: Run 6-question framework (4–5 yes), scoring rubric (8 criteria), hard filters per idea. Output: 04_SCORING.md—per-idea 6Q answers, rubric scores, pass/fail, total. Shortlist ordered by score.

Step 5 — Challenge: Per shortlisted idea: Who already does it? Why could it fail? Why now? Re-check landscape (incumbents focus? well-funded? bootstrap? no competition → why?). Challenge the system: familiar patterns? cleverness vs revenue? Output: 05_CHALLENGE.md—revised shortlist, written kill reasons, risks, assumptions.

Step 6 — Synthesis: Structure by Startup cheatsheet (Pain, Business, Market, Team, Competition, Technology, Product, Strategy, Customers, Marketing, Investment). Per top idea: one-liner, why now, 90-day experiment, what would kill it. Competition section must reflect 02_LANDSCAPE_ANALYSIS. Output: 06_SYNTHESIS.md.

Step 7 — Close: Update 00_RESEARCH_INDEX.md (row for run, outputs, next action). Update 17_CURRENT_IDEAS_SUMMARY.md (new ideas, clusters). Update 19_MEMORY_AND_IMPROVEMENT.md if lessons learned. Optional: 07_RUN_SUMMARY.md in run folder (outcome, top ideas, links to 00/17/19).
